New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 33 points, marking a significant contribution to the Thunder's win.
The Thunder achieved their 14th consecutive win, showcasing their strong performance streak.
Key Match Events: Aaron Wiggins scored 15 of his 19 points in the fourth quarter, sparking a crucial 25-10 run with three 3-pointers and a three-point play.
Oklahoma City erased an 88-80 deficit by outscoring the Knicks 37-19 in the final period.
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder had a 29-5 record, indicating strong performance prior to this game.
The Knicks had a 25-10 record, showing their competitiveness but facing a strong opponent in the Thunder.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder's coach highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship.
Isaiah Hartenstein, playing against his former team for the first time, contributed significantly with 14 rebounds, seven assists, and four points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the fourth in NBA history between teams on winning streaks of nine games or more.
New York led 66-54 at halftime but faced a strong comeback from the Thunder.
Others: The Thunder's performance set the stage for their third comeback in three games, showcasing their resilience.
